unnormalised: Okay, so you're online, right? But sometimes, it feels like everyone's speaking a different language. Don’t worry, you're not alone! The internet, especially social media, has its own set of abbreviations and jargon. Understanding these "internet terms" is key to not feeling like a total newbie. Think of it as learning a new dialect – a digital one! For instance, you might see someone type "IMO" which simply means "In My Opinion". It’s all about quick communication in a text-based world.

Think of it as learning a new dialect – a digital one! For instance, you might see someone type "I-M-O" which simply means "In My Opinion". It's all about quick communication in a text-based world.

unnormalised: Let’s break down some common ones. You’ve probably seen "LOL" – Laughing Out Loud. But did you know there's also "LMAO" (Laughing My A** Off) and "ROFL" (Rolling On the Floor Laughing)? Choose wisely depending on the funniness of the content! Then there's "BRB" (Be Right Back) which is handy when you need to quickly step away from your device. I often see "TBH" (To Be Honest) used, sometimes when people are being…well, honest! And of course, who hasn't used "OMG" (Oh My God!) at some point?

unnormalised: Now, let’s talk about hashtags. These are those words or phrases preceded by a "#" symbol. They're used to categorize content on social media platforms like Twitter or Instagram. For example, #India, #Diwali, or #TechTrends2024. Clicking on a hashtag will show you all the posts using that same tag. It's a great way to discover content and join conversations around specific topics. I’ve even seen hashtags like #AIBRoast.

unnormalised: Other terms you might encounter include "DM" (Direct Message), which is a private message sent to someone on a social media platform. And if someone mentions "AMA," they’re likely referring to "Ask Me Anything," a popular format on Reddit where people answer questions from the public. Don't get bogged down by all the terms, just pick up the most common ones and you’ll be navigating the digital world like a pro in no time. BTW, that’s “By The Way” if you didn’t already know!

And remember, it’s okay to not know everything. Just have fun and embrace the ever-changing landscape of internet lingo.
